column4: hi. in ubuntu 9.04 when i click on taskbar it takes some time to register the click. why is that? i am using kde.
#kubuntu is probably best
ok
run them in a terminal, and try to catch the error message
it crashes and says that even though the frontend has crashed the backend will be running.
is there any progress with the free ati drivers? When is the complete version going to be released?
what card? and what version of ubuntu?
ati radeon hd4670 and jaunty
sorry I got distracted, yes the closed and open source drivers should both work for that card. Let me doublecheck
it works alright but not 3d i guess.. is there any way i can check whats the progress on the card drivers?
okay, the closed source drivers support that card, and the open source drivers have experimental 3D support for that card
how are you checking it?
http://cgit.freedesktop.org/xorg/driver/xf86-video-radeonhd/plain/README
thanks.
any chances of installing a dbg version of jockey or envy?
err which driver do you want to use, fglrx or radeonhd?
fglrx.. but then i will revert to radeonhd as it looks way stable and better.
err okay. To install the fglrx drivers do sudo apt-get install xorg-driver-fglrx
i am following this elaborate ritual http://wiki.cchtml.com/index.php/Ubuntu_Jaunty_Installation_Guide
I'm sorry I have to go now :)
take a look at http://popey.com/blog/2009/06/05/Easy_Script_To_Get_And_Install_PPA_GPG_Keys/ to get GPG keys for PPA's automatically
i am not using any ppas.
